result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Undergo risk & needs evaluation.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

  The Court may grant you an early discharge following successful completion of the conditions of this court order, adherence to the rules of your supervision, and upon the recommendation of your agent.

supervisions.notes:
The first 4 months are to be served in custody of the jail without release;  the remaining 2 months are to be served on GPS monitoring with House Arrest through Justice Support Services
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse County case 15CF695
.
